Genocide Accountability Act of 2007
To amend section 1091 of title 18, United States Code, to allow the prosecution of genocide in appropriate circumstances.

bill.summary: 12/4/2007--Reported to House without amendment. Genocide Accountability Act of 2007 - Amends the federal criminal code allow the prosecution of acts constituting genocide committed by an alleged offender who is: (1) an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the United States; (2) a stateless person whose habitual residence is in the United States; or (3) brought into, or found in, the United States, even if the offense occurred outside the United States.
